meanings.definition: To wander or roam around in search of pleasure or amusement.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys galavanting through the park on sunny days.
meanings.sent2: The children were galavanting around the playground, laughing and playing.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was galavanting around the house, chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The wind was galavanting through the trees, rustling the leaves.
meanings.sent5: The stream was galavanting down the mountain, glistening in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To go around in a lively or carefree manner.
meanings.sent1: The dancers were galavanting across the stage, full of energy and grace.
meanings.sent2: After finishing his work, he went galavanting through the city streets.
meanings.sent3: The cat was galavanting around the house, jumping from furniture to furniture.
meanings.sent4: The kite was galavanting in the sky, dancing with the wind.
meanings.sent5: The leaves were galavanting in the breeze, swirling and twirling in the air.
